Founded in 1954, Coastal became an independent university in 1993. The University enrolls approximately 8,300 students on its {{convert|307|acre|km2|adj=on}} campus. Baccalaureate programs are offered in 51 major fields of study, along with graduate programs in education, business administration ([[MBA]]), coastal marine and wetland studies, and writing. The school is composed of its main campus in Conway and also offers courses in Litchfield, Myrtle Beach and [[North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina|North Myrtle Beach]]. The University is a [[Sea-grant]] institute and owns part of [[Waties Island, South Carolina|Waties Island]], a {{convert|1105|acre|km2|sing=on}} barrier island which serves as a natural laboratory. Coastal Carolina is also the home of the [[Scholars Academy]], a high school program for gifted students. ==Academic Organization== ===[http://www.coastal.edu/business/ The E. A crowning achievement of the University's student activities, the Coastal Carolina Chanticleer Rugby team (a member of [http://www.usarugbysouth.com/ USA Rugby South ] ) won the Small College National Championship in 2009. ==Greek life== ===Fraternities=== * [[Alpha Phi Alpha]] * [[Delta Chi]] * [[Kappa Alpha Psi]] * [[Kappa Sigma]] * [[Pi Kappa Phi]] * [[Sigma Phi Epsilon]] * [[Sigma Alpha Epsilon]] * [[Tau Kappa Epsilon]] * [[Phi Beta Sigma]] * [[Phi Gamma Delta]] * [[Omega Psi Phi]] ===Sororities=== * [[Alpha Delta Pi]] * [[Alpha Xi Delta]] * [[Alpha Kappa Alpha]] * [[Gamma Phi Beta]] * [[Delta Sigma Theta]] * [[Zeta Phi Beta]] (Suspended until 2015)http://www.thesunnews.com/2010/08/13/1634449/sorority-kicked-off-ccu-campus.html * [[Sigma Sigma Sigma]] * [[Phi Sigma Sigma]] ==Athletics== {{Main|Coastal Carolina Chanticleers}} Coastal Carolina's athletic programs compete in [[NCAA Division I]] as a member of the [[Big South Conference]] (the [[Coastal Carolina Chanticleers football|football]] team competes in the [[NCAA Football Championship Subdivision]]). The primary colors of the university's athletic programs are teal, black and bronze. Until the mid-1960s Coastal's teams were known as the Trojans. Upon its affiliation with the University of South Carolina, the push was made for a mascot more in line with the parent's mascot (the Gamecock); the ultimate choice was the [[Chanticleer_and_the_Fox|Chanticleer]] (pronounced SHON-ti-clear), the proud, witty rooster made famous in "[[The Nun's Priest's Tale]]" of [[Chaucer|Chaucer's]] ''[[Canterbury Tales]]'' (the mascot itself would be named Chauncey).
